intro: Pleurophora squarrosa, commonly known as the rough-hairy pleurophora, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in moist, woodland environments and is valued for its ornamental qualities.
